JUST IN: By a vote of 300-128, the House adopted the conference report, sending legislation to fund the entire government through Sept. 30th & fund key national priorities to the President‚Äôs desk. Read @AppropsDems Chairwoman @NitaLowey‚Äôs full statement ‚Üí  https://appropriations.house.gov/news/press-releases/house-passes-legislation-to-keep-government-open-fund-key-priorities¬†‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/IDPMdAmeSA

Neither Democrats nor Republicans got everything they wanted, yet every Democrat and nearly every Republican who served on the conference committee to write this bill has signed it in support.

@NitaLowey: ‚ÄúI urge a yes vote.‚Äù
The $1.375 billion it provides for border barriers is 76% less than the President demanded for a concrete wall, and critical protections are put in place for environmentally sensitive areas.

The Homeland Security division of this bill upholds Democratic values and funds smart and effective border security including construction and screening technology at ports of entry, where most drugs illegally enter the country. pic.twitter.com/m5JfyogKE2
Federal workers will receive a 1.9% pay raise that the President attempted to deny hardworking families. pic.twitter.com/ssS63HLtQd
Strong international affairs funding will help stabilize the world economy, meet unprecedented humanitarian needs, and continue our fight against radical extremism and terrorism.

Among the bill‚Äôs vital increases are:
 
‚úÖ $80 million for state and local law enforcement to keep communities safe;
‚úÖ $1 billion for the Census Bureau
‚úÖ $308 million for research and development at the NSF
‚úÖ $25 million for the @EPA
‚úÖ $293 million for port infrastructure
Additionally, it does not contain poison pill riders that threatened the environment, public health, and consumer protections in the House Republican versions of these bills.
This bipartisan compromise rejects the President‚Äôs irresponsible budget cuts & instead invests in priorities that will strengthen our families, communities, and economy.

THREAD: @AppropsDems Chairwoman @NitaLowey on the conference agreement under consideration: 

The bill before us represents what is possible in a strong democratic process, when we work hard to reach agreement that puts politics aside & puts the American people first.

HAPPENING NOW: The House is debating the bipartisan, House & Senate conference legislation to keep the government open & fund smart, effective border security measures without compromising our values OR funding President Trump‚Äôs border wall. Watch ‚Üí  http://live.house.gov¬†

Today‚Äôs conference agreement funds smart & effective border security measures, & provides funding to ensure a more humane immigration system. 

The legislation funds key priorities, including $ for hiring more immigration judges & funding construction projects at ports of entry. pic.twitter.com/EDy81BbMVv

By rejecting the President‚Äôs proposed cuts to critical global initiatives & ensuring crucial support for our allies, today‚Äôs conference report strengthens American global leadership and funds programs that reflect American values. pic.twitter.com/mnNQdU1PDw

Protecting our natural & cultural heritage is a key priority of the conference agreement reached by House & Senate negotiations ‚Äì including investments like $8.8 billion for the @EPA and rejecting proposed eliminations of the National Endowment for the Arts & for the Humanities. pic.twitter.com/gm3oXgGxeG

ALSO in today‚Äôs bipartisan conference agreement: $3.8 billion for the Census Bureau ‚Äì an increase of $1 billion ‚Äì to ensure a fair & accurate count in the 2020 Census #Census2020 pic.twitter.com/jyIX3MKSw5

Restoring & increasing investments in job-creating initiatives for economic & business development are key provisions in the conference report. The bill has specific investments for minority and women-owned businesses, programs that the Trump Administration had tried to slash. pic.twitter.com/FdVkGyo2FR

Investments to restore & rebuild America‚Äôs infrastructure are central to today‚Äôs conference agreement under consideration. It includes $17 billion for new infrastructure investments to improve our roads, bridges, highways, railways and mass transit. pic.twitter.com/jEOu82sBCg

The bipartisan, bicameral conference agreement includes NO FUNDING for Trump‚Äôs border wall, provides a glide path to reduce ICE detention beds, & funds $415m for humanitarian assistance to migrants‚Äìprioritizing a more humane immigration system & smart, effective border security. pic.twitter.com/T828ekrLDB

Today‚Äôs legislation keeps the government open, funds critical priorities, & secures a 1.9% raise for federal civilian employees ‚Äì overriding the President‚Äôs decision to deny them a pay raise & ensuring federal workers & their families continue to make a living wage for their work pic.twitter.com/mwKpc5yeMD

The conference agreement being considered in the House today, a product of bipartisan & bicameral negotiations, guarantees critical investments across the U.S. to build safer communities, combat the opioid crisis, close sexual assault kit backlogs, & hire more police officers. pic.twitter.com/WZWNzxMiXz
